data.name: Msg_ActionDescription_AddAttribute
data.value: AddAttribute action is used to add some customized attribute to the corresponding managed types of the tlb types.

data.name: Msg_ActionDescription_ChangeManagedName
data.value: ChangeManagedName action is used to give tlb type a customized managed name instead of the default one.

data.name: Msg_ActionDescription_ConvertTo
data.value: ConvertTo action is used to convert tlb function parameter to the user-specified managed signature. When converting a tlb function signature into managed function signature, TlbImp may not do as what we want, because TlbImp does not have all information. For example, “HRESULT Func(int *intArray)” will be converted to “void Func (ref int intArray)”. ConvertTo action can convert the “int *” to a fixed array, for example, “void Func (int[20] intArray)”.

data.name: Msg_ActionDescription_PreserveSig
data.value: In a normal function conversion process, TlbImp will use the [out, retval] parameter as the return value to substitute HResult return value and when error occurs, an exception will be thrown. If we perform a function conversion with PreserveSig, the original signature will be preserved, and TlbImp will not put the [out, retval] parameter in the return place in the function signature.

data.name: Msg_ActionDescription_ResolveTo
data.value: In the conversion process, when TlbImp comes across some unknown tlb type, TlbImp will try to resolve this new tlb type to a managed type. ResolveTo action is used to resolve a tlb type to a user-specified managed type.

data.name: Msg_EditUninitializedActionTip
data.value: double click sub nodes to edit...

data.name: Msg_InstructionAboutAddNewRule
data.value: Please select Category and Action to create a new rule. After a new rule is created, please go to the rule file panel in the main dialog to edit the Condition and Action.

data.name: Msg_MainFormTitle
data.value: TlbImp Config File Editor

data.name: Msg_NoParametersToEdit
data.value: This action does not have any parameters to edit.

data.name: Msg_NoRuleFileToSave
data.value: No rule file to save.

data.name: Msg_RemoveRuleQuestion

data.value: The current rules have some changes. Do you want to save the changes?

data.value: Save File

data.name: Wrn_ActionUninitialized
data.value: The action of rule '{0}' is not initialized.

data.name: Wrn_AssemblyLoadFailed
data.value: Cannot load assembly '{0}'.

data.name: Wrn_BadParameterInput
data.value: The input parameter value '{0}' for type '{1}' is invalid.

data.name: Wrn_CannotUseByteDataInputHelper_CtorNotFound
data.value: Cannot use byte data input helper, because constructor '{0}' cannot be found in the type '{1}'.

data.name: Wrn_CannotUseByteDataInputHelper_CtorNotSelected
data.value: Cannot use byte data input helper. Select a constructor first.

data.name: Wrn_CannotUseByteDataInputHelper_ParameterNotSupported
data.value: Cannot use byte data input helper. Input helper do not support parameter type '{0}'.

data.name: Wrn_CannotUseByteDataInputHelper_TypeNotLoaded
data.value: Attribute type is null or not loaded successfully. Cannot use byte data input helper.

data.name: Wrn_EmptyCompositeCondition
data.value: Condition '{0}' should have at least one sub condition.

data.name: Wrn_InvalidByteData
data.value: The byte data is invalid. Input data in the hexadecimal way.

data.name: Wrn_InvalidCondition
data.value: The condition is not complete. The previous modification is not accepted.

data.name: Wrn_InvalidSizeParamIndexOffset
data.value: 'SizeParamIndexOffset' is invalid.

data.name: Wrn_LoadRuleFileFailed
data.value: Cannot open rule file '{0}'. The xml format is invalid.

data.name: Wrn_ManagedTypeCannotBeLoaded
data.value: Type '{0}' of Assembly '{1}' cannot be loaded.

data.name: Wrn_NoManagedTypeSelected_TypeSelector
data.value: No managed type is selected. Select a type in the treeview first please.

data.name: Wrn_NoRuleFileToAddRuleTo
data.value: No rule file to add rule to.

data.name: Wrn_NoTlbTypeSelected_TlbTypeSelector
data.value: No type library type is selected.

data.name: Wrn_ParseDataFailed
data.value: Parsing byte data according to constructor '{0}' failed. The data does not match with the parameter list of the constructor.

data.name: Wrn_SaveRuleFileFailed
data.value: Saving rule file failed. There exists invalid rule. Please check the conditions before saving.
